column4: Hello, anybody feel like helping me with a grub related problem_
Again, kinda desperate for help here..
can you restate your question please?
I have some trouble with grub, or rather I wont boot at all
okay, what's the error message?  we need that.
mount the old distro's / partition somewhere, chroot to it, mount /boot if needed (if it was separate) and run grub-install /dev/sda <- if sda is your first hard disk
can you tell me what grub-install says?
I already told you to cp -R /dev/* /mountedpartition/dev
devices.map only lists the hard disks
grub only needs the bootsector installed with grub-install.
the rest is up to menu.lst in /boot/grub
Back in my own partition, I owe you a beer sir
you do not owe me anything, the satisfaction of having you run linux is enough :-)
